title: Systems of Linear Equations

vocab.definition: Two or more equations with the same variables
The point where two lines intersect
Solving by replacing one variable with an expression
Solving by adding or subtracting equations to eliminate a variable
Lines that never intersect and have no solution

teachingNotes: Start with graphical solutions, then introduce algebraic methods. Use real-world problems involving two unknowns.

sample.question: What are two or more equations with the same variables called?

truefalse.question: The solution to a system is where the lines intersect.

multiplechoice.question: What happens when you solve by elimination?

fillintheblank.question: Lines that never intersect are called ________ lines.

shortanswer.question: Solve the system: x + y = 5 and x - y = 1

wordProblems.question: Two numbers add to 12 and their difference is 4. What are the numbers?
